title: Curriculum Improvement Design for Integrating Social and Participatory Media

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Exploration of strategically integrating social and participatory media into university-level curricula to enhance engagement and effectiveness, adopting a blended approach combining online and offline activities

learning_goals: Learners can evaluate and analyze the effectiveness of social media-based educational activities using action research methodology
Learners can design educational scenarios integrating modern pedagogical approaches (flipped learning, collaborative learning, etc.) with social media tools

Learners can conduct at least three feedback collection sessions (e.g., student surveys, peer evaluations) at two-week intervals and establish/submit two or more action plans for curriculum improvement based on analysis results

resources: Access Rights to Social Media Platforms (Facebook Groups, Padlet, etc.)
Educational Digital Content Creation Tools (Canva, Miricanvas, etc.)
Online Collaboration Tools (Google Workspace, MS Teams, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
